settings.name: zones
settings.label: Zones
settings.help: In this table you can define a set of zones in which you can specify various audio properties.

settings.name: enable_filter
settings.help: positional audio stream uses lowpass filter

settings.name: unattenuated_zone
settings.label: Unattenuated Zone
settings.help: Boxes for source and listener (corner x, corner y, corner z, size x, size y, size z, corner x, corner y, corner z, size x, size y, size z)

settings.name: attenuation_per_doubling_in_distance
settings.label: Attenuattion per doubling in distance
settings.help: Factor between 0.0 and 1.0 (0.0: No attenuation, 1.0: extreme attenuation)

settings.name: dynamic_jitter_buffer
settings.label: Dynamic Jitter Buffers
settings.help: dynamically buffer client audio based on perceived jitter in packet receipt timing

settings.name: static_desired_jitter_buffer_frames
settings.label: Static Desired Jitter Buffer Frames
settings.help: If dynamic jitter buffers is disabled, this determines the target number of frames maintained by the AudioMixer's jitter buffers

settings.name: max_frames_over_desired
settings.label: Max Frames Over Desired
settings.help: The highest number of frames an AudioMixer's ringbuffer can exceed the desired jitter buffer frames by

settings.name: use_stdev_for_desired_calc
settings.label: Use Stdev for Desired Jitter Frames Calc:
settings.help: use Philip's method (stdev of timegaps) to calculate desired jitter frames (otherwise Fred's max timegap method is used)

settings.name: window_starve_threshold
settings.label: Window Starve Threshold
settings.help: If this many starves occur in an N-second window (N is the number in the next field), then the desired jitter frames will be re-evaluated using Window A.

settings.name: window_seconds_for_desired_calc_on_too_many_starves
settings.label: Timegaps Window (A) Seconds:
settings.help: Window A contains a history of timegaps. Its max timegap is used to re-evaluate the desired jitter frames when too many starves occur within it.

settings.name: window_seconds_for_desired_reduction
settings.label: Timegaps Window (B) Seconds:
settings.help: Window B contains a history of timegaps. Its max timegap is used as a ceiling for the desired jitter frames value.

settings.name: repetition_with_fade
settings.label: Repetition with Fade:
settings.help: dropped frames and mixing during starves repeat the last frame, eventually fading to silence

settings.name: print_stream_stats
settings.label: Print Stream Stats:
settings.help: audio upstream and downstream stats of each agent printed to audio-mixer stdout
